instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..

threads.title: [SOLVED]MacBook Pro 13" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Early 2011 both USB ports dead - no liquid damage
threads.message:
[PLAIN][SOLVED]MacBook Pro 13" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Early 2011 both USB ports dead - no liquid damage[/PLAIN]

[h=2]Working on a MacBook Pro 13.3" - Early 2011 logic board that has both USB ports dead.[/h] Everything else seems to work properly and it's otherwise a very normal <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>. Inspection under a scope shows absolutely no signs of liquid damage, obvious burns on the board or probe points.

I've already tested the usual L4600 & L4610 suspects and have both have good continuity.  Any tips on where I should look next would be much appreciated.

threads.title: [SOLVED]MacBook Pro 13" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Early 2011 both USB ports dead - no liquid damage
threads.message: Is there 5V power from the ports? USB HDD spinning up? Diode mode on both data pins of the ports?

threads.title: [SOLVED]MacBook Pro 13" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Early 2011 both USB ports dead - no liquid damage
threads.message: 5V is not present on either USB port.

threads.title: [SOLVED]MacBook Pro 13" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Early 2011 both USB ports dead - no liquid damage
threads.message: Check around <CHIP>U4600</CHIP>, is 5V getting to it? Is the enable present? Is there a short on the 5V rail after <CHIP>U4600</CHIP>? Could be just a bad <CHIP>U4600</CHIP>.

threads.title: [SOLVED]MacBook Pro 13" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Early 2011 both USB ports dead - no liquid damage
threads.message: <CHIP>U4600</CHIP> has 5V present on pins 2 & 3 and 2.3V present on pins 6 & 10

threads.title: [SOLVED]MacBook Pro 13" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Early 2011 both USB ports dead - no liquid damage
threads.message: pins 4 and 5 are 3v? No short on output pins 8/9? Probably bad <CHIP>U4600</CHIP>.

threads.title: [SOLVED]MacBook Pro 13" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Early 2011 both USB ports dead - no liquid damage
threads.message: Yes pins 4 & 5 are 3V , pins 2 & 3 are 5v, no short on pins 8 or 9.   Bad <CHIP>U4600</CHIP> ?

threads.title: [SOLVED]MacBook Pro 13" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Early 2011 both USB ports dead - no liquid damage
threads.message: Replaced <CHIP>U4600</CHIP> and both ports are working normally now.  Thanks for the guidance.
